backend/main.mo: Main ICP actor defining user profiles, projects, workflows, and tasks with CRUD operations, enforcing role-based access control via MixinAuthorization and AccessControl helpers.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing two implemented features: fixing backend call failures after login (registerUser signature, Candid types, SetupPage mutation) and displaying the logged-in user's principal ID in the chat header.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-sentence summaries of all frontend source files, describing their roles in the chat application's UI, hooks, and styling.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based light and dark theme CSS custom properties for colors, borders, sidebar, and chart tokens.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the React app, mounting the root div and loading the main TypeScript entry point as an ES module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root app component that routes between LoginPage, SetupPage, and ChatPage based on Internet Identity authentication state and whether a user profile exists, with flash-prevention via isFetched guard.
frontend/src/components/ChatHeader.tsx: App header component displaying the logo, theme toggle, and a user dropdown that shows the authenticated user's display name, truncated principal ID with a copy-to-clipboard button, and a logout option.
frontend/src/components/ConversationList: Left sidebar component rendering a searchable conversation list with skeleton loading, empty states, and a New Chat dialog for selecting users to start conversations.
frontend/src/components/MessageThread.ts: Renders the message thread panel for a selected chat user, displaying grouped messages by date, a scrollable message list, and a textarea input for sending messages with Enter-key support.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor using React Query, invalidating dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context with login/logout functionality, AuthClient management, and a React context provider/hook for accessing identity state throughout the app.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for user profile management and chat UI operations (conversations, messages, users), along with frontend-only TypeScript types for chat entities.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports fonts, configures Tailwind CSS, and defines OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light/dark themes including chat-specific color tokens.
frontend/src/lib/utils.ts: Exports a single `cn` utility function that merges Tailwind CSS class names using clsx and tailwind-merge.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers around the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/ChatPage.tsx: Top-level chat page component that manages selected conversation state and mobile view toggling, composing the ChatHeader, ConversationList sidebar, and MessageThread main panel.
frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx: Renders the login landing page with Internet Identity sign-in button, feature highlights (Private, Fast, Simple), and branding header.
frontend/src/pages/SetupPage.tsx: Renders a first-time setup form where newly authenticated users enter a display name (2â€“32 chars) and register their profile via the backend, with inline error handling.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides utility functions for reading URL/hash query parameters, persisting them to sessionStorage, and cleaning sensitive params from the URL bar without a page reload.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining the design system: OKLCH-based color tokens, custom border radii, box shadows, font families, and keyframe animations, with typography, container-queries, and animate plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks overall project state (version 9) including architecture notes, known issues (IC deployment failures, registerUser errors), and the list of implemented features for this Internet Computer chat app.
